intro: Pavetta petraea, commonly known as the rock pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, spherical berries. Pavetta petraea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
